intro: Scrophularia mapienensis, commonly known as the Mapien scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in East Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes a variety of flowering plants often found in temperate and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers that bloom during the wet season. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
